metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3185 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the command_port_read_callback function indrivers/usb/serial/whiteheat.c in the Whiteheat USB Serial Driver in theLinux kernel before 3.16.2 allow physically proximate attackers to executearbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and systemcrash) via a crafted device that provides a large amount of (1) EHCI or (2)XHCI data associated with a bulk response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-37-generic - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-37.64
linux-image-3.13.0-37-lowlatency - 3.13.0-37.64

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-37.64').
